Ok, I think I found a lot of information in the developer's manual, but I h=
ave a very primary question: where do I get the heritrix source code, where=
 I can put my module? The .tar.gz I loaded contains only binary and no sour=
ce... 

thanks for your help!

Ewa 



--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.c=
om, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> There is no bundled component for d=
oing so, but it should be easy to 
> write, either in Java or one of the sc=
ripting languages Heritrix supports.
> 
> You don't mention which version y=
ou're using, so I'll assume Heritrix 
> 3.0.0+ ("H3").
> 
> Every processor=
 may optionally have its own DecideRule (or more 
> usefully, set of rules =
via something like DecideRuleSequence), called 
> 'shouldProcessRule'. If c=
hanged from the default (an always-ACCEPT 
> rule), and the rule returns RE=
JECT, the Processor's normal activity will 
> be skipped.
> 
> Thus, adding=
 rules to whatever Processor is doing your content-writing 
> such that the=
y REJECT uninteresting content will have the desired effect.
> 
> Rules are=
 passed the CrawlURI instance, which for any successful fetch 
> includes w=
ays to access the retrieved content as either an InputStream 
> or a CharSe=
quence. Rules may be written in Java or via the 
> ScriptedDecideRule class=
, supplied with their behavior by any JSR-223 
> scripting engine. Javascri=
pt (aka ECMAScript), Beanshell, and Groovy 
> should always be available as=
 options in our standard distribution; 
> adding JRuby or Jython or Clojure=
 shouldn't be hard.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> On 7/29/10 9:21 AM, e.bartosiew=
icz wrote:
> > I'm trying to do a crawl using Heritrix, but I can't find on=
e crucial module which would be able to filter the content of the fetched p=
ages before writing them into the archive. I need to write only the pages t=
hat contain given keywords. Is that possible? Am I going to have to write s=
omething myself? How can I write my own filter for Heritrix?
> >
> >
> > Th=
anks for any help in this matter!
> >
> > Ewa
> >
> >
